pattern.name: Moral Bildungsroman
pattern.core_dynamic: First-person retrospective narration with tight character-mediated alignment creates intimate access to moral development while maintaining formal distance through temporal remove.
pattern.reader_effect: Readers experience Jane's emotional journey intimately while gaining wisdom perspective through the mature narrator's moral framework and accumulated understanding.

voice.pov_description: First-person narration from Jane's perspective throughout
voice.focalization_description: Limited to Jane's internal perception and understanding

device_mediation.summary: Literary devices accumulate to support Jane's moral and emotional development, with figurative language, symbolism, and dialogue mediating her transformation from powerless orphan to independent woman who achieves equality in love through moral strength rather than social position.

micro_devices.name: First-Person Narration
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: There was no possibility of taking a walk that day
micro_devices.effect: Establishes intimate retrospective voice that creates immediate access to Jane's subjective experience while maintaining temporal distance through mature narrative tone

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: red moreen curtain nearly close, I was shrined in double retirement
micro_devices.effect: The curtained enclosure symbolizes Jane's marginalized position and need for protection, foreshadowing her moral journey toward finding legitimate shelter and belonging

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: death-white realms I formed an idea of my own
micro_devices.effect: Creates atmospheric connection between Jane's inner desolation and external landscapes, establishing pattern of psychological states reflected in natural imagery

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Each picture told a story; mysterious often to my undeveloped understanding
micro_devices.effect: Hints at Jane's future capacity for deeper moral understanding while establishing her current position as developing consciousness interpreting symbolic meanings

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I was a discord in Gateshead Hall; I was like nobody there
micro_devices.effect: Contrasts Jane's nature against the Reed family environment, establishing the moral conflict that will drive her bildungsroman journey toward finding compatible community

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: my reason, forced by the agonizing stimulus into precocious though transitory power
micro_devices.effect: Presents reason as a faculty that can be awakened by moral crisis, establishing pattern of Jane's growth through ethical challenges that develop her judgment

micro_devices.name: Repetition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Why was I always suffering, always brow-beaten, always accused, forever condemned
micro_devices.effect: Emphasizes the systematic nature of Jane's oppression while building toward her moral awakening and future assertion of self-worth

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: the chestnut-tree. It stood up, black and riven
micro_devices.effect: Creates intimate access to Jane's moral interpretation of the destroyed tree as prophetic symbol while maintaining formal distance through her reflective analysis of its meaning

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I feared my hopes were too bright to be realized
micro_devices.effect: Provides retrospective narrator's subtle hint at coming disaster while preserving Jane's innocent perspective in the moment of telling

micro_devices.name: First-Person Narration
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Stay till he comes, reader; and, when I disclose
micro_devices.effect: Creates intimate bond between mature narrator and reader while building suspense about moral crisis to come

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: her disk was blood-red and half overcast
micro_devices.effect: Provides sensory access to Jane's moral intuition about impending doom while allowing reader to interpret symbolic meaning independently

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: You, sir, are the most phantom-like of all
micro_devices.effect: Contrasts Jane's spiritual uncertainty with Rochester's material confidence, revealing her developing moral awareness of their relationship's instability

micro_devices.name: Repetition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: I wish he would come! I wish he would come!
micro_devices.effect: Emphasizes Jane's emotional dependence while the retrospective frame suggests the narrator's awareness of this as moral weakness

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: my whole world, and more than the world—almost my hope of heaven
micro_devices.effect: Reveals the moral danger of idolatry through intimate confession while temporal distance allows mature judgment of past spiritual blindness

micro_devices.name: Dramatic Irony
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Mrs. Rochester! she did not exist; she would not be born
micro_devices.effect: Creates tension between Jane's innocent anticipation and reader's awareness that this identity will indeed never come to exist, deepening moral complexity

micro_devices.name: Metaphor
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: To me, he was in reality become no longer flesh, but marble
micro_devices.effect: Creates intimate access to Jane's moral perception of relationships without love, establishing the dehumanizing effect of duty divorced from feeling through first-person retrospective insight

micro_devices.name: Imagery
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: His eye was a cold, bright, blue gem; his tongue, a speaking instrument
micro_devices.effect: Provides visceral access to Jane's developing understanding of loveless relationships through sensory details that reinforce moral bildungsroman themes via character-mediated perception

micro_devices.name: Foreshadowing
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: if I were his wife, this good man...could soon kill me
micro_devices.effect: Anticipates her ultimate rejection of his proposal while revealing moral growth through intimate first-person insight into the dangers of sacrificing authentic feeling for duty

micro_devices.name: Symbolism
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: The avalanche had shaken and slid a little forward, but it did not yet crash down
micro_devices.effect: Represents the suppressed emotional violence beneath religious duty, allowing retrospective moral analysis of how spiritual authority can mask destructive impulses

micro_devices.name: Juxtaposition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: To his sisters, meantime, he was somewhat kinder than usual
micro_devices.effect: Contrasts his coldness toward Jane with warmth toward others, deepening first-person moral insight into manipulative aspects of his character through comparative observation

micro_devices.name: First-Person Narration
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Reader, do you know, as I do, what terror those cold people
micro_devices.effect: Creates intimate moral guidance through direct reader address, establishing the retrospective wisdom that characterizes the bildungsroman pattern while maintaining formal narrative distance

micro_devices.name: Repetition
micro_devices.anchor_phrase: Jane! Jane! Jane!
micro_devices.effect: Emphasizes the spiritual/supernatural intervention that resolves her moral crisis, providing climactic moment where authentic feeling triumphs over duty through repeated mystical summons
